main event: An unidentified object was observed moving at an estimated speed of 3,000 miles per hour in a northwesterly direction near Point Conception, California in 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed on radar at a speed of 3000 MPH, with an estimated constant velocity of 25,000 MPH.
Both the navigator and radar operator, who had combat experience, witnessed the object and considered it reliable.
The visual description by the pilot corroborated the electronic data, indicating the existence of a definite unidentified object.
A yellow-white light was observed, disappearing vertically at a high rate of speed.
There were no deviations from normal weather conditions to account for the radar anomaly.
